comments.body:
You should be doing a dictionary instead of list.

In fact you should be setting these known options as actual documented module options i.e. have `optimize_in_use_files: yes/no`, `no_compress`, `verify`, minimum_file_age_days`. Having an open list/dict of options means user's have to go and read other docs to see what is available and work from there. If we document the options explicitly then they can read our docs and we don't have to handle arbitrary input.

You don't need to implement all the options straight away, maybe just what you need right now.
